cards.english: a ritual knife does not lack blood
cards.context: Traditional saying about ritual preparation - tools are ready when needed
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: a mouth that has words does not lack something to say
cards.context: About eloquence and having something meaningful to contribute
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: one who walks the earth does not lack a trap
cards.context: Life is full of obstacles and challenges
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: a communal pot does not lack a stirrer
cards.context: Community work always finds willing hands
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: there is always a stomach that does not lack
cards.context: Someone is always hungry or in need
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: an enemy does not lack a spy
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: a head and hunger do not kill a brave person
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: what bears three is increased by its owner
cards.context: Good things multiply when properly cared for
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: going leaves room for a person to return
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: a person without goats does not want meat
cards.context: You appreciate what you don't have
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.

cards.english: the heart eats what it wants
cards.cultural_notes: Traditional Kikuyu proverb from Wiktionary sources preserving cultural wisdom and moral teachings. These represent centuries of accumulated knowledge and social values.
